intro: Puya rusbyi, commonly known as the Andean torch, is a striking plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is a member of the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its tall, spiky inflorescence that resembles a torch. The plant features broad, strap-like leaves that form a rosette, often covered in a dense layer of white, woolly hair. Puya rusbyi is adapted to cold, dry environments and can survive in harsh alpine conditions. Its unique appearance and ecological significance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
